New Records: Pakistan successfully broke the record for the highest ever run chase in a World Cup.
Key Match Events: Mohammad Rizwan scored 134 runs and was named Player of the Match.
Abdullah Shafique posted a superb 113 in his first ever World Cup match.
Sri Lanka scored 344/9 in 50 overs, while Pakistan chased it down with 345/4 in 48.2 overs.
Pre-Game Insights: Babar Azam decided to play Shafique after watching his form in the nets.
Sri Lanka's batting coach, Naveed Nawaz, emphasized the need for the bowling unit to learn from the South Africa game and execute better against Pakistan.
Mickey Arthur, the director of the Pakistan team, hoped to use his knowledge of Sri Lanka against them.
Post-Match Reflections: Shanaka reflected that Sri Lanka left 20-25 runs out there with the bat, adding only 61 runs in the last 10 overs for the loss of 5 wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Theekshana mentioned that the wickets in India are less forgiving, and Sri Lanka’s inexperienced bowlers are struggling in these batting-friendly conditions.
Four different centuries were scored by Mendis, Sadeera, Shafique, and Rizwan, marking the beginning of a new phase in each batter's career.
